intro: Hieracium euglaucum, commonly known as the blue hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and meadows, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually blue or purple, with ray florets that resemble petals. Hieracium euglaucum is often found in disturbed habitats and can be invasive in certain regions.
